page.title: 08Education in Scaleby
page.content: There is no school in the village now; children have to go to {Smithfield.} The school building has become the Parish Hall. The school closed in 1933. It took children from 5 to 14 years and had two teachers for the 45 to 60 pupils, and these were all taught in one large room. School started a 9 a.m. and finished at 3.30 p.m. except on Fridays. Then the finish was at 3p.m. to let children get home to help their parents get produce ready for market. Each year in March there was an 11 plus examination to choose pupils for grammar school. The School year started in April. The only education for children in Scaleby is the Playgroup which meets in the Parish Hall.
